text: For project management on the boilerplate, do you guys strictly use github or do you use any PM software?

We are primarily just using GitHub projects for our future release planning. We usually just figure out what open issues in the repo are most pressing/what makes sense to include in the next version and then create a project board prior to any work on an upcoming release and add all the issues for that release to the project board so there is some visibility into what we are working on before the release.
not gonna lie, I use clickup for personal management of my tasks that need to be done. Things like non-work tasks or ideas for work that are side projects)
